title: Strensiq
description: STRENSIQ速 (asfotase alfa) is used to treat perinatal/infantile- and juvenile-onset hypophosphatasia (HPP).

title: NMOSD
description: Learn about neuromyelitis optica spectrum disorder (NMOSD) causes, diagnosis, symptoms, testing, and treatment.

title: Koselugo
description: Learn more about KOSELUGO速 (selumetinib), the first and only FDA approved treatment for NF1 PN.

title: aHUS
description: AHUS Source provides services to people with autoimmune hemolytic anemia (AHUS). AHUS is a rare and life-threatening blood disorder that occurs when the body's immune system attacks its own red blood cells.

title: Strensiq HCP
description: STRENSIQ速 (asfotase alfa) is used to treat perinatal/infantile- and juvenile-onset hypophosphatasia (HPP).

title: HPP
description: This website provides information about Hypophosphatasia (HPP). HPP is a rare genetic disorder that affects the way your body uses phosphorus. Phosphorus is important for strong bones and teeth, and for muscle and nerve function. People with HPP have low levels of phosphorus in their blood, which can lead to a variety of problems, including bone pain, fractures, muscle weakness, and problems with breathing and swallowing.

title: NMOSD-HCP
description: Learn more about neuromyelitis optica spectrum disorder, the importance of AQP4-IgG antibodies, relapses, terminal complement pathway, and the burden your patients may face.

title: Koselugo-HCP
description: Learn about KOSELUGO速 (selumetinib), a treatment for neurofibromatosis type 1 (NF1) and symptomatic, inoperable plexiform neurofibromas (PN) in pediatric patients 2 years of age and older.

title: nf1andpninfo
description: Learn more about NF1 with PNs (neurofibromatosis type 1 with plexiform neurofibromas).

title: nf1andpninfo-hcp
description: Learn more about NF1 with PNs (neurofibromatosis type 1 with plexiform neurofibromas).
